ANU.name: Christine Nicholls
ANU.colleges: College of Arts and Social Sciences
expertise: Humanities And Social Sciences Curriculum And Pedagogy Excl. Economics Business And Management
Aboriginal And Torres Strait Islander Cultural Studies
interest: Australian Studies across a broad spectrum; Visual Art including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander art; Sociology; Sociolinguistics; Humour Studies; Australian literature including Aboriginal liteerature and Eco-crime literature; Australian politics.
ANU.biography: Have published more than 20 books through commercial publishers, for both adults and children, and while at Flinders published numerous peer-reviewed articles (see ResearchGate Flinders) as well as visual art catalogues). Visual art reviewer for The Advertiser for many years in the 90s; and have written extensively for The Conversation.
project: I'm currently writing a series of articles about over-valued books, beginning with Bruce Chatwin's The Songlines, with more to follow.
In addition I'm writing a book on humour and rhetoric.
